text: Rye Beach is a community in the U.S. state of New Hampshire. It used to be called Pannaway. It is along the Atlantic Ocean. It is in Rye, New Hampshire, United States. It is along New Hampshire Route 1A, near the south of a town named "Rye". In the community, there is a hostel. It is called the "Ocean house" and it was built in 1884. When it was built, it was small, but over time, it reached 4 stories and it had room for 250 guests. It was called the Philbrick Hotel when it was first built, but an Admiral called David Farragut visited the hotel, so it sometimes was called "Farragut House".Tolles, Bryant Franklin. Summer by the seaside: the architecture of New England coastal resort hotels. == References == Category:Settlements in New Hampshire Category:Unincorporated communities in the United States Category:1884 establishments in the United States Category:1880s establishments in New Hampshire
title: Rye Beach, New Hampshire
